main event: Two veteran RCAF pilots reported sighting one bright light moving rapidly across the skies over North Bay, Ontario at approximately 9:55 P.M. EST on Saturday, April 12, 1952.
interesting points: The object was observed for about one minute and was said to be moving at a high rate of speed.
The manner of observation was clearly visible, and no sound whatsoever was reported.
The two observers were officers of the RCAF station at North Bay.

A bright amber-colored light was reported to have come in from the southwest, moved across the sky station at North Bay, stopped, and then moved off again in the reverse direction before climbing at an angle of 30 degrees at terrific speed and disappearing.
The sightings were thoroughly investigated by the Air Force, but no definitive explanation was provided.
witnesses: two veteran RCAF pilots, RCAF personnel
